edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Class AlignmentGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.AlignmentGrid

  • public class AlignmentGrid
extends Object
    A representation of an AlignmentTemplate collection as a matrix. Note that rows correspond to e, and columns correspond to f.
    Author:
    Michel Galley

        public void addAlTemp(int f1,
             int f2,
             int e1,
             int e2)
        Add coordinates of an alignment template to the grid. Allows to cut down memory usage, since one doesn't need to allocate each alignment template.

      • printAlTempInGrid

        public void printAlTempInGrid(String id,
                     AlignmentTemplateInstance alTemp,
                     PrintStream out)
        Display alTemp and word alignments in the alignment grid. The alTemp is displayed as a big filled square, and individual word alignments are shown as crosses ("x"). The grid also displays contextual alignment templates that are consistent with alTemp (consistent means both E and F spans do not overlap). For instance, the "1" symbol indicates the location of the bottom-left corner of any alignment template found north-west relative to altemp. The same goes for "2", "3", and "4" for the three other directions.

      • printDecoderGrid

        public static void printDecoderGrid(Featurizable<IString,String> f,
                    PrintStream out)
        Print alignment grid corresponding decoding history.
